isis.stitle: TSI 05-12-16 - Fuel Dilution (Fuel in the Oil) Diagnosis with Dye

subjectgroup.subject: Fuel Dilution (Fuel in the Oil) Diagnosis with Dye

geninfo.para: Oil contaminated with diesel fuel (fuel dilution) will have a diesel fuel odor and the oil level in the engine will increase. A leaking fuel injector or injector O-ring will cause fuel dilution. A leaking injector sleeve or injector tip could also cause fuel dilution, but would most likely be identified as an engine performance problem. Suspected fuel dilution should be verified by oil analysis.
There are other issues that may also contribute to fuel dilution, beside fuel injectors:
If the engine is mechanically sound and the oil has been changed, diagnose for fuel in the oil with dye.

note.para: Use only recommended dye, manufactured by Balkamp, Inc., available at local NAPA Auto Parts stores, part number 765-2661.

geninfo.para: Contact Tech Services, (800) 336-4500, open a case, if set (six) of injectors must be replaced.

note.para: This procedure is approved for use on I6 engines serial 2000001 and above only. This procedure is an extension of EGES-270 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Diagnostic Manual. This procedure is not approved for use in V8 or V6 engines.

calloutgroup.callout1: Fuel valve assembly air bleed and pressure test port

step1.para: Verify oil contamination.
Remove fuel filter housing cover assembly, discard O-ring.
Add two ounces of dye to fuel filter header.
Put replacement O-ring in housing cover assembly. Install housing cover assembly and torque to 33 to 37 Nm (24 to 27 lbf·ft).

note.para: The O-ring is available in Fuel Filter Kit, 1842638C91, or individually, 1841394C1.

step1.para: Place a rag or suitable container under fuel pressure test valve. Press in on fuel pressure test valve, on fuel rail, while pumping the fuel primer pump. Continue until dyed fuel starts to flow from fuel pressure test valve.
Verify there is a yellow/green fluorescent glow to the fuel. Check the fuel with AC Leak Kit (UV Lamp) (ZTSE4618). Dispose of rags, containers, and fuel according to local regulations.
Prime the fuel system. See EGES-265 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Service ManualSection 12.
Remove valve cover. See EGES-265-1 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Service Manual.
Start and run engine at idle for three to five minutes.

With the engine running, inspect for yellow/green streams of dye running between valve spring seats at each injector. Use AC Leak Kit (UV Lamp) (ZTSE4618). A small inspection mirror can aid in inspecting hard to reach areas.

note.para: Test as indicated in steps 9 and 10 should take no longer than an additional three to five minutes. Because of disbursement of dye in fuel, amount of dye seen is not necessarily indicative of severity of failure, just that failure exists.

caution.para: To avoid possible engine damage, do not take corrective action if a positive indication is found on whole set of injectors. Check to see if engine oil has been changed. Initial engine oil from the plant has dye in it.

step1.para: Once leak has been found, do steps 12 through 16. If no leak is found, go to step 17.
Shut down engine.
Remove high pressure rail. See EGES-265-1 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Service Manual.
Inspect failed injector. Failed injector will have a solid yellow/green color around intensifier body area. Use AC Leak Kit (UV Lamp) (ZTSE4618).
Open fuel valve assembly air bleed and pressure test port, relieve all pressure in fuel system to avoid further contamination of the oil.
Replace leaking fuel injector. See EGES-265 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Service Manual.
Shut down engine.

note.para: If no dye or leak is found after engine has been running, make sure there is a fuel dilution issue to begin with through oil analysis or watching for an oil level increase.

step1.para: Remove high pressure rail. See EGES-265-1 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Service Manual.
Without removing the fuel injectors, closely inspect areas around each injector and hold-down clamp. Use AC Leak Kit (UV Lamp) (ZTSE4618).
Once leak has been found, do steps 21 and 22. If no leak is found go to step 23.
Open fuel valve assembly air bleed and pressure test port, relieve all pressure in fuel system to avoid further contamination of the oil.
Replace leaking fuel injector. See EGES-265-1 DT 466, DT 570 and HT 570 Service Manual.
Open fuel valve assembly air bleed and pressure test port, relieve all pressure in fuel system to avoid further contamination of the oil.

note.para: When removing each fuel injector, hold the fuel injector over the injector opening for several seconds for fuel to drain out of the injector. Place a rag or fuel injector holder cup under the fuel injector to avoid contaminating other injectors during removal. Dispose of rags, containers, and fuel according to local regulations.

step1.para: If no leakage is found and fuel dilution is verified, remove each fuel injector individually. See EGES-265-1 DT 466, DT 570 and HT 570 Service Manual.

note.para: When the fuel injector is in the fuel injector holder cup, do not allow fuel to get above top O-ring and contaminate weep hole.

step1.para: Inspect weep hole, where hold-down clamp indexes on injector body, for each injector. Fuel leaking out of weep hole indicates a failed injector. Use AC Leak Kit (UV Lamp) (ZTSE4618).
Replace leaking fuel injector. See EGES-265 DT 466, DT 570, and HT 570 Service Manual.
